metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4148 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel's block_invalidatepage in fs/buffer.c in the filesystem. A missing sanity check may allow a local attacker with user privilege to cause a denial of service (DOS) problem.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1012-aws - 5.13.0-1012.13~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1013-azure - 5.13.0-1013.15~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1052-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1007.8~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1013-gcp - 5.13.0-1013.16~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-28-generic - 5.13.0-28.31~20.04.1

notes.Note: sbeattie> reproducer links in second lore email likely introduced in eb6ecbed0aa2 (v5.14) no fix upstream as of 2022.02.11
